children.subject: That's been true for about the past 2 years, but is no longer the case aka the APR should be accurate now; see @8853.

As far as I know, CS advisors have asked us to NOT trust Academic Progress Report for CS major requirements fulfillment status. So, I would email them.

But again, I ain't sure, so mentioning it as a follow-up.

history.content:
As per the official UC Berkeley website, CS 161 has been a valid design course for the CS major since Spring 2019. However, in my "Academic Progress Report" on CalCentral, it is not showing my 4 units of my upper division design class being satisfied.

I'm posting this here because I have already been turned away 3 times, once by CS advisors (no appointments until well after my Phase 1 enrollment period), next by drop-in advising (was never let into the Zoom room), and finally once again by my scheduled EECS academic advisor, Natacha Crooks.

Any help whatsoever would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.
history.subject: CS 161 Not Showing Up as a Design Course in My Academic Progress Report
